paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 K897T polymorphism, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: healthy middle-aged subjects (121 women and 107 men)
patients.phenotype: cardiac repolarization assessed by T-wave morphology

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 K897T polymorphism was associated with TCRT values reflecting cardiac repolarization.

variants.additional_notes: The study suggests functional significance of the K897T polymorphism for cardiac electrical properties.
key_quotes: Subjects with a less common genotype, KT or TT, have smaller TCRT, which reflects dyssynchrony between depolarization and repolarization and is associated with an increased risk of cardiac mortality.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 gene was successfully extracted.
